page.title: 17CHURCHES
page.content: {Exterior of church.}Half of the church was built in the 12th.century.The man who was building it had an argument with {Sir Henry Vavasour,}the local landowner who owned the quarry from which the limestone was being used. The argument was because Henry Vavasour wanted his statue on the top niche in the tower but the man who was building the church would not allow it.So Sir Henry Vavasour said he could not have any more limestone.So the rest of the church was built with sandstone from another quarry. The clock has a red face one of very few in the country.
